lines.text: Visions are worth fighting for. Why spend your life making someone else's dreams?
Karloff? Sidekick? FUCK YOU! Karloff did not deserve to smell my shit! That limey cocksucker can rot in Hell for all I care!
What happened?
How dare that asshole bring up Karloff? You think it takes talent to do Frankenstein? It's all makeup and grunting.
[Mocks Frankenstein]
Bela, I agree with you 100%. Now, "Dracula," that's a role that requires talent.
Of course. Dracula requires presence. It's all in the eyes, and the voice, and the hands...

[interrupting]
That's right. That's right. You seem a little agitated. You wanna to go outside and get some air?
Bullshit! I'm ready now! Roll the camera!
[At the "Plan 9" premiere]
This is the one. 'This' is the one I'll be remembered for.

[after Thor Johnson bumps into a scenery wall while walking through a door making the wall shudder]
Ok, and CUT! PERFECT! PRINT IT!
Don't you wanna do another take Ed? Seems like big baldy had some problems gettin' through that door.
No, it's fine. It's real. You know, in actuality, Lobo would have to struggle with this problem every day.
[Impersonating Bela Lugosi]
I want to suck your blood. I want to suck your blood!
Let's hear you call Boris Karloff a cocksucker.
Do you know that I've even had producers re-cut my movies?
I hate when that happens.
And they always want to cast their buddies. It doesn't even matter if they're right for the part.
Tell me about it. I'm supposed to do a thriller for Universal. They want Charlton Heston as a Mexican.

Home? I have no home. Hunted... despised... living like an animal. The jungle is my home! But I will show the world that I can be its master. I shall perfect my own race of people... a race of atomic supermen that will conquer the world!
We don't have a permit. Run!
This is the most uncomfortable coffin I've ever been in. Your selection is quite shoddy. You are wasting my time.
[Bunny Breckenridge is being baptized]
Welcome to the fold, brother. Welcome. Praise the lord, brother. Do you reject Satan and all his evils?
Sure.
[after his baptism, Bunny swims towards Ed Wood]
How do you do it? How do you get all your friends to get baptized just so you can make a monster movie?
It's not a monster movie. It's a supernatural thriller.
Listen, I was wondering if you'd like to go out sometime, grab some dinner, maybe?
You mean a date? I thought you were a fag.
No, no, I'm just a transvestite.
[repeated line]
Cut! That was perfect!

[on phone with Mr. Feldman]
Really? Worst film you ever saw. Well, my next one will be better. Hello. Hello.
You people are insane! You're wasting your lives making shit! Nobody cares! These movies are terrible!
Ed, what's *my* motivation?
You're the file clerk. You're running into the next room and you run into Janet.
But are we good friends or is she just a casual acquaintance?
Dolores, I have five days to complete this picture. Don't get goofy on me.
I refuse to drive in this country. Too many madmen.
And cut! Print. We're moving on. That was perfect.
Perfect? Mr. Wood, do you know anything about the art of film production?
Well, I like to think so.
That cardboard headstone tipped over. This graveyard is obviously phony.
Nobody will ever notice that. Filmmaking is not about the tiny details. It's about the big picture.
The big picture?
Yes.
Then how 'bout when the policemen arrived in daylight, but now it's suddenly night?
What do you know? Haven't you heard of suspension of disbelief?

Why, if I had half a chance, I could make an entire movie using this stock footage. The story opens on these mysterious explosions. Nobody knows what's causing them, but it's upsetting all the buffalo. So, the military are called in to solve the mystery.
You forgot the octopus.
No, no, I'm saving that for my big underwater climax.
[Bela Lugosi casts a love spell on Vampira who is on TV while moving his fingers like Dracula]
My Gosh, Bela, how do you do that?
You must be double-jointed. And you must be Hungarian.
Eddie, we're in show biz. It's all about razzle-dazzle. Appearances. If you look good, and you talk well, people will swallow anything.
What about glitter? When I was a headliner in Paris, audiences always liked it when I sparkled.
No!
Cat's Eyes.
No!
Well, I'm going to need some antennae.
No! You're the ruler of the galaxy! Show a little taste!
[Waiting to be baptized in a swimming pool]
Why couldn't we do this in the church?
Because Brother Tor couldn't fit in the sacred tub.
[Stepping into water]
GODDAMN, it's cold!
It'll warm up once you're in it.
FUCK YOU! You come out here!
I met Bela Lugosi.
Why, I thought he was dead.
No, he's very much alive. Well, sort of.
[Bela Lugosi answers the door on Halloween night wearing his Dracula costume]
Trick or treat!
[At the sight of Dracula, all but one little boy scream and run away]
Aren't you scared, little boy? I'm going to drink your blood!
You're not a real vampire. Those teeth don't frighten me.
[Bela looks puzzled. Ed Wood appears next to him in the doorway]
How 'bout these?
[Pulls out his entire row of front teeth]
[Little boy screams and runs away]
Hey... How d'you do that?
Dentures!
[Holds them up]
Lost my pearlies in the war!
So, what was the important news you couldn't tell me on the phone, again?
Well, I started thinking about what you were saying about how your movies need to make a profit. Now, what is the one thing, if you put it in a movie, it'll be successful?
Tits.
No, better than that. A star.
Kid, you must have me confused with David Selznick. I don't make major motion pictures; I make crap.
Yes, but if you take that crap and put a star in it, then you've got something.
Yeah. Crap with a star.
[while he and the others flee the chaotic premiere of "Bride of the Monster" in a cab]
Now that was a premiere.
[on the phone to Bunny]
Listen, hit the bars, work some parties, and get me transvestites. I need transvestites. All right. Bye.
Eddie, what kind of a movie is this?
Eddie's the only fella in town who doesn't pass judgment on people.
That's right. If I did, I wouldn't have any friends.
You know, you're, you're much scarier in real life than you are in the movie.
Thank you.
...and then, Dr. Vornoff falls into the pit, and his own octupus attacks and eats him. The end.
Whew! That's quite a story.
Yes.
So, uh, you made the movie, and now you wanna make it again?
No. We shot ten minutes of the movie, and now we're looking for completion funds.
Oh, son, you're too vague.
[Yells to one of his butchers]
BILLY BOB! You're cuttin' em too lean.
Mr. McCoy. How can I make you happy?
I want the movie to end with a big explosion. Sky full of smoke.
Yes. But it ends with Dr. Vornoff falling into the pit.
I got a son. Little slow, but a good boy, and somethin' tells me he'd make a helluva leadin' man.
[pointing to a "Jacob's Ladder" on the set of Bride of the Atom]
I'm not getting near that goddamn thing. One of them burned me in "The Return of Chandu".
[on the reason for the success of 'Dracula(1931)']
They were mythic. They had a poetry to them.
Yes.
And you know what else? The women... the women preferred the traditional monsters.
The women? Huh?
The pure horror, it both repels, and attracts them, because in their collective unconsiousness, they have the agony of childbirth. The blood. The blood is horror.
You know, I never thought of that.
Take my word for it. If you want to make out with a young lady, take her to see "Dracula".
What are you drinking, Bela?
Formaldehyde
Straight up or on the rocks?

[arriving for her scenes in "Bride of the Monster"]
Well, I see the usual cast of misfits and dope addicts are here.

[about to start filming at night]
"All right, lets shoot this fucker!"
Before we start shooting, Mr. Wood, we have a few questions.
Yes. The script contains numerous references to graverobbing. Now we find the concept of digging up consecrated ground to be highly offensive. It is blasphemy.
What are you talking about, it's the premise of the movie. It's the title of the movie for Christ sakes.
But Mr. Wood!
Yes, about that title. It strikes us as very inflammatory. Why don't we change it to Plan 9 from Outer Space.
Huh. That's ridiculous.

[referring to Tor Johnson]
Why did you give HIM all the dialog? He is unintelligible!
Look, Bela's dead and Vampira won't talk. I had to give somebody the dialog!
This story's gonna grab people. It's about this guy, he's crazy about this girl, but he likes to wear dresses. Should he tell her? Should he not tell her? He's torn, Georgie. This is drama.
Is there a script?
Fuck no. But, there's a poster.
Boy, Mr. Lugosi, you must lead such an exciting life! When is your next picture coming out?
I have no next picture.
You gotta be joking, a great star like you? You must have dozens of them lined up!
Back in the old days, yes... Now, no one gives two fucks for Bela.
But you're a big star!
No more. I haven't worked in four years. This business, this town, it chews you up, then spits you out.
[pauses]
I'm just an ex-boogeyman.
They don't want the classic horror films anymore. Today it's all giant bugs. Giant spiders, giant grasshoppers... Who would believe such nonsense?
Why would Lugosi wanna do a sex-change flick?
Because he's my friend!
[On the phone, agitated]
Look, look, look, when I said that you could have the western territories, I didn't mean all 11 states! I meant California, Oregon, and, uh, what's that one on top...
[Looks at map]
Washington! Yeah, yeah. Oh, really? Well, *screw you*!
I like to dress in women's clothing.
You're a fruit?
No, not at all. I love women. Wearing their clothes makes me feel closer to them.
You're not a fruit?
No, I'm all man. I even fought in W.W.2. Of course, I was wearing women's undergarments under my uniform.

[Reading a review]
Look, he's got some nice things to say here. "The soldiers' costumes are very realistic." That's positive!
Rave of the century.

[First lines]
Greetings, my friends! You are interested in the unknown. The mysterious. The unexplainable. That is why you are here. And now, for the first time, we are bringing you the full story of what happened. We are giving you all the evidence based only on the secret testimony of the miserable souls who survived this terrifying ordeal. The incidents, places. My friends, we cannot keep this a secret any longer. Can your heart stand the shocking facts of the true story of Edward D. Wood Jr.?
Mr. Reynolds.
Yes.
We are going to finish this picture just the way I want it... because you cannot compromise an artist's vision.
But it's OUR money.
And you're gonna make a bundle, but only if you shut up and let me do things my way.
Pull the string! Pull the string!
[making up the bald Dr. Tom to look like Bela Lugosi]
Ed, what am I gonna do here.
What do you mean?
He has no hair.
Gee, I never noticed that. Put a wig on him!
You're watching our Halloween movie, "White Zombie", starring Bela Lugosi, John Harron, Madge Bellamy, and a bunch of other people I've never heard of.
Oh, what does that old queen know?
Are you people insane? I'm the director. I make the casting decisions around here.
[Bride of the Monster wrap party. Mariachi band plays "Que sera sera"]
Mister Bunny, what's wrong? I heard you were becoming a lady.
Oh, that. Mexico was... a nightmare. We got into a car accident... he was killed. Our luggage... was stolen. The surgeon... turned out to be... a quack. If it hadn't been for these men...
[gestures to the Mariachi band]
I don't know... how I would have... survived,

[watching Vampira on TV]
I think she's a honey. Look at those jugs.
[Ed is cross-dressed on the set of "Glen or Glenda"]
How can you just walk wound like that in front of all these people?
Well hon, nobody's bothered but you. Look around.
Ed, this isn't the real world. You've surrounded yourself with a bunch of WEIRDOS!
Oh say it a little louder, I don't think Bela heard you!
[Bela, in his Dracula costume, hears the doorbell on Halloween night]
Children! I love children.
It's a guaranteed blockbuster.
Hmm. Ah, I understand this science fiction is popular, but uh, don't the big hits always have big stars?
Bela Lugosi.
Bela Lugosi? Why, I though he passed on.
Yes. Yes he did. But...
[produces tiny spool of film]
I've got the last footage he ever shot.
Well, it doesn't look like very much.
Mr. Reynolds, this is the acorn that will grow a great oak! I'll just get a double to finish his scenes, and we'll release it as "Bela Lugosi's Final Film"!

[talking on phone]
Bunny? We're making another movie! Yes. I got the Baptist Church of Beverly Hills to put up the cash!

[knocking on door]
Ed, I got the Lugosi doubles outside!
Bunny, I gotta go...
[Ed opens the door to find a short man, a fat man, and a Chinese man]

[sighs, shakes head]
He's too short, he's too... tall, he's... just not going to work.
Well, Ed. I was thinking like when Bela played Fu Manchu...
[Pulls Paul aside]
[wispering]
Paul, that was Karloff.
[watching Tor Johnsson at his wrestling match]
Guess where I'm going next week.
I don't know. Where?
Mexico. Guess what I'm doing when I get there.
I don't know. Lie on a beach.
Wrong. I'm getting my first series of hormone injections. And when thos girls kick in, they're going to take out my organs, and make me a woman.
Are you serious?
I have to take action! GOODBYE PENIS!

[obviously annoyed]
Could you please keep it down?
Oh my goodness, you gave me the willies! You look like that Dracula guy.
My name is Bela Lugosi... and I wish to commit myself.
For what reason?
I have been a drug addict for twenty years. I NEED HELP!
I'm a movie director.
Movies? You mean like the Mickey Mouse?
Whose crazy idea was it to bury him in the cape?
I heard it was in the will. It was how he wanted to be remembered.

[sees Ed come out in drag]
Mr. Wood, what do you think you're doing!
I'm directing.
Not like *that* you're not.
Remove that getup immediately. You shame our lord.
Dolores, I have 5 days to finish this picture. Don't get goofy on me.

[after the fake octopus falls on him]
Better than wrestling!
Bela, would you like a wine?
No. I never drink... wine.
Hey Cris, how'd you know we'd be living on Mars by 1970?
I guessed. I made it up.
[Leans over to Ed]
It's horseshit.

[Ed looks very crestfallen]
Really...
Eddie, there's no such thing as a psychic. People believe my folderol because I wear a black tuxedo.

[Still looking disappointed, but perking up]
It's that easy?
Eddie, we're in show biz. It's all about razzle-dazzle. Appearances. If you look good and you talk well, people will believe anything.
My girlfriend still doesn't know why her sweaters are always stretched out.
They're driving me CRAZY. These Baptists are stupid. Stupid. STUPID.
Kathy... I'm about to tell you something that I never told any girl on a first date. But I think it's important that you know... I like to wear women's clothes.
Huh?

I like to wear women's clothes. Panties, brassieres, sweaters, pumps. It's just something I do. And I can't believe I'm telling you this, but I really like you, and I don't want it getting in the way down the road.
Does this mean... you don't like sex with girls?
No, I love sex with girls.
[long pause]
Okay.
[Finds Bela ailing]
This happens all the time.
Is there anything I can get for you? Water or a blanket?
Goulash.
I don't know how to make goulash.
[See the track marks on Bela's arm]
Bela, what's in the needle?
Morphine. With a demerol chaser.
Say, let's get married.
Huh?
Right now. Let's go to Vegas.
But, Eddie, it's pouring and the car top is stuck.
Phooey. It's only a five hour drive and it'll probably stop by the time we get to the desert. Heck, it'll probably stop by the time we get around the corner. Let's go.
Hi, would you like some water?
No. No water. No liquids! I'm terribly allergic to them.
Actors! I must have my actors!
Is something wrong, Bela?
